Hancock, whose works are sufficient 
evidence of the value of his lecturing - <s>had <\s>
permits me to say that he long since 
arrived at the <s>same<\s> conclusion - that 
no such arteries exist - What has given rise to the notices of 
the existence of these arteries appears to 
me to be this - A narrow band <s>like the <\s>
resembling those  I have already 
described - is attached in <u>Waldheimia <\u>
along the base of the ‘ventricle’ and the 
contiguous outer parietes of the auricle-:
<s>posteriorly <\s> inferiorly it passes outwards to the 
sinuses and running along their inner wall 
forms a sort of ridge or axis * from which 
the genitalia, whether ovaries or testes 
are developed - stretching through their 
whole length & following the ramifications 
of the sinuses  - It is the base of these 
ridges seen through the walls of the 
sinuses, where they extend beyond the
